snippet: WEISSMAN--Julia Zlabovsky, 98, died on October 15, 2015 after a brief illness. Born in El Paso, Texas, she graduated from the College of Mines and Metallurgy of the University of Texas and later settled in New York City to pursue a career as a writer and editor. As author or co-author, she published books and articles in many areas of the arts and crafts, including folk art, needlework and cooking. She was predeceased by her sisters, Vera Zlabovsky and Esther Boxer and by her brothers Isador (Saul) Stuart and David Stuart. She is survived by her daughter Erica Weissman, brother Frank Stuart, nephew David Stuart, nieces Elizabeth Stuart and Rebecca Orlowski (Steven), and grandnephews Jesse, Derek, and Paul Orlowski. 1/3
lead_paragraph: WEISSMAN--Julia Zlabovsky, 98, died on October 15, 2015 after a brief illness. Born in El Paso, Texas, she graduated from the College of Mines and Metallurgy of the University of Texas and later settled in New York City to pursue a career as a writer and editor. As author or co-author, she published books and articles in many areas of the arts and crafts, including folk art, needlework and cooking. She was predeceased by her sisters, Vera Zlabovsky and Esther Boxer and by her brothers Isador (Saul) Stuart and David Stuart. She is survived by her daughter Erica Weissman, brother Frank Stuart, nephew David Stuart, nieces Elizabeth Stuart and Rebecca Orlowski (Steven), and grandnephews Jesse, Derek, and Paul Orlowski. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  WEISSMAN, JULIA ZLABOVSKY
